content: /=Before you can respond, Juno and Eyvind arrive. Her hollow appearance catches you off guard.=/
[eyvind] "That's not entirely true. We've been working on something Juno learned about at Geirraðr's godstone."
[$hero] "But I would've never made it this far without you."
[$hero] "But these people depend on me. I gave them my oath we would get to Arberrang."
[$hero] "But this caravan needs the three of you. I need you to help get these people to Arberrang."
[$hero] "But we're almost to Arberrang."
[$hero] "Have you looked around lately? We lost almost half the damn caravan and now you three want to leave too?"
/=Days have passed since Eyvind pulled Juno from the Serpent. Though the menders are mostly back to their normal selves, the clansmen continue to keep their distance. =/
[$hero] "I'm not sure I'm still cut out for this. We've lost a lot of people."
[$hero] "I'm worried about all the people we're missing. Scattering like that in the Old Wood...I feel guilty."
[$hero] "That was never meant for you."
[$hero] "What he could. What's this all about?"
[$hero] "What? Join them where?"
[$hero] "Why would you do this to me? Why now? Look at what's left of this caravan."
[$hero] "You help me and this entire caravan every day."
[$hero] "You keep saying 'you' instead of 'we'. Are you trying to tell me something?"
[iver] "All three of us."
[iver] "And here I thought I didn't have a father. Can I go if I finish my chores?"
/=Iver grunts his amusement.=/
[iver $hero] "And then what? The human capital full of varl, and fearing war from the dredge."
[iver $hero] "An opportunity to do something, to help out."
[iver $hero] "Besides, what else can you do? You'll stay alive, and as long as you do, these people are going to follow you."
[iver $hero] "I'm glad you feel that way. I wish it was enough."
[iver $hero] "I'm not sure what I'm getting myself into with these two, but it feels right. I've always tried to follow that."
[iver $hero] "I've seen who is left. A bunch of humans and varl who depend on you and Hakon, not me."
[iver $hero] "Juno and Eyvind. They want me to join them."
[iver $hero] "No doubt whatever they have planned will be dangerous, but sticking with you hasn't really been the safest route either."
[iver $hero] "Then I've done my job. This isn't easy, but don't make it harder than it has to be."
[iver $hero] "Then keep going. From the moment you left Skogr, you knew everyone wouldn't make it, but the rest of you can."
[iver $hero] "The truth is I've been looking for something for awhile now, and this might be it."
[iver $hero] "They haven't filled me in on most of the plans, but they said I'm needed and that we're leaving the caravan."
[iver $hero] "They haven't filled me in on most of the plans, but they said I'm needed and that we're leaving the caravan."

content.option: "I'll need to talk to them about this."

content: [iver $hero] "You can't prepare for a giant snake busting up your camp."
[iver $hero] "You do what you have to do, but that's no place for me."
[iver] "I've never had a mother. And the way you're acting, I don't think I'd want one."
[iver] "Whatever happened to the idea that everyone here can leave when they want?"
[juno] "Beyond that, the Serpent's attack has clarified our need to move quickly, something we cannot do with all of you."
[juno] "Iver told you of our plans?"
[juno] "That's right. Lend me your map."
[juno] "We are no longer good for the caravan. Our presence not only scares the clansmen, but puts them in real danger."
/=Confused, you hand your map to the Valka. She and Eyvind hold it at the corners while tracing patterns with spear and staff.=/
{skip} mark1=$hero mark2=juno mark3=iver mark4=eyvind
/=The giant varl sighs.=/
/=The map glows faintly, and loose threads from her cloak and his tunic snake through the aged material. The image pulses; it looks alive.=/
/=You sigh.=/
